text.0: who mitravaruṇa is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven.
text.1: preserve us in the seat of holy order and give the offerer power that winneth cattle.
text.2: may mitra varuṇa aryaman and Āyu indra Ṛbhukṣan and the maruts love us.
text.3: and they who of one mind with bounteous rudra accept the hymn and laud with adorations.
text.4: you will i call to feed the carhorse aśvins with the winds flight swiftest of those who travel.
text.5: or also to the asura of heaven worshipful bring a hymn as twere libation.
text.6: the heavenly victor he whose priest is kaṇva tṛta with dyaus accordant vāta agni.
text.7: allfeeding pūṣan bhaga sought the oblation as they whose steeds are fleetest seek the contest.
text.8: bring ye your riches forward borne on horses let thought be framed for help and gain of treasure.
text.9: blest he the priest of auśija through courses the courses which are yours the fleet o maruts.
text.10: bring hither him who yokes the car your vāyu who praises with his songs the god and singer.
text.11: and praying and devout noble and prudent may the gods spouses in their thoughts retain us.
text.12: i speed to you with powers that should be honoured with songs distinguishing heavens mighty daughters.
text.13: morning and night the two as twere allknowing these bring the sacrifice unto the mortal.
text.14: you i extol the nourishers of heroes bringing you gifts vastospati and tvaṣṭar.
text.15: rich dhiṣaṇā accords through our obeisance  andtrees and plants for the swift gain of riches.
text.16: ours be the parvatas even they for offspring freemoving who are heroes like the vasus.
text.17: may holy Āptya friend of man exalted strengthen our word for ever and be near us.
text.18: tṛta praised him germ of the earthly hero with pure songs him the offspring of the waters.
text.19: agn with might neighs loudly like a charger he of the flaming hair destroys the forests.
text.20: how shall we speak to the great might of rudra how speak to bhaga who takes thought for riches.
text.21: may plants the waters and the sky preserve us and woods and mountains with their trees for tresses.
text.22: may the swift wanderer lord of refreshments listen to our songs who speeds throuih cloudy heaven.
text.23: and may the waters bright like castles hear us as they flow onward from the cloven mountain.
text.24: we know your ways ye mighty ones receiving choice meed ye wonderful we will proclaim it.
text.25: even strong birds descend not to the mortal who strives to reach them with swift blow and weapons.
text.26: celestial and terrestrial generations and waters will i summon to the feasting.
text.27: may days with bright dawns cause my songs to prosper and may the conquered streams increase their waters.
text.28: duly to each one hath my laud been offered strong be varūtrī with her powers to succour.
text.29: may the great mother rasā here befriend us straighthanded with the princes striving forward.
text.30: how may we serve the liberal ones with worship the maruts swift of course in invocation the maruts farrenowned in invocation.
text.31: let not the dragon of the deep annoy us and gladly may he welcome our addresses.
text.32: thus thinking o ye gods the mortal wins you to give him increase of his herds of cattle the mortal wins him o ye gods your favour.
text.33: here he wins wholesome food to feed this body as for mine old age nirrti consume it.
text.34: o gods may we obtain from you this favour strengthening food through the cows praise ye vasus.
text.35: may she who gives good gifts the gracious goddes s come speeding nigh to us for our wellbeing.
text.36: may iḷā mother of the herds of cattle and urvasi with all the streams accept us.
text.37: may urvasi in lofty heaven accepting as she partakes the oblation of the living.
text.38: visit us while she shares urjavyas food.
